lead_paragraph: A Canadian court ordered that Omar Khadr, a Canadian who was captured in Afghanistan in 2002 at age 15, be released on bail pending an appeal of his conviction by an American military tribunal.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | The Americas; Canada: Bail for a Former Child Soldier
headline.main: Former Guantánamo Inmate Is Granted Bail in Canada

snippet: A Canadian court ordered that Omar Khadr, a Canadian who was captured in Afghanistan in 2002 at age 15, be released on bail pending an appeal of his conviction by an American military tribunal.
abstract: Canadian court orders release on bail of Omar Khadr, who as 15-year-old child soldier was captured by American forces in Afghanistan, held at Guantanamo Bay detention center and charged with murder for killing American sergeant in battle.
